alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 10:41PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Jewell, Smith, western Clay, Nuckolls, eastern Franklin, Webster, Adams, southwestern Hamilton and Hall Counties through 1115 PM CDT... At 1040 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cairo to Wood River to near Roseland to near Bladen to 9 miles south of Riverton to near Athol. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Juniata, Roseland and Ayr around 1045 PM CDT. Blue Hill and Cowles around 1050 PM CDT. Doniphan, Alda, Glenvil, Rosemont and Hansen around 1055 PM CDT. Lawrence, Trumbull, Inland and Bellaire around 1100 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Grand Island, Fairfield, Giltner, Lebanon, Clay Center, Burr Oak, Edgar, Nelson, Esbon and Nora. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 293 and 322. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for north central Kansas...and south central Nebraska.
